Package PayrollProcessing

Class Company

  • java.lang.Object
    • PayrollProcessing.Company
  • public class Company
extends java.lang.Object
    The Company class used to hold all the employees and number of employees. Allows access to run a company with employees.
    Author:
    Muhammad Faizan Saiyed, Michael Neustater

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Employee[] emplist  
      (package private) static int NOTFOUND  
      private int numEmployee  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Company()
      Method to create a company object with the default array of employees of size 4.

      Method to grow the employee array if the array is full.

      Method to check if the company is empty, having no employees.

      • find

        private int find​(Employee employee)
        Method to find an employee within the employee array in the Company Class.
        Parameters:
        employee - takes in the employee that needs to be found in the company.
        Returns:
        the index where the employee was found in the employee array.

      • grow

        private void grow()
        Method to grow the employee array if the array is full.

      • add

        public boolean add​(Employee employee)
        Method to add an employee to the company.
        Parameters:
        employee - takes in the employee that is going to be added to the company.
        Returns:
        a boolean value of true if added, false if the employee already exists or is not an employee.

      • remove

        public boolean remove​(Employee employee)
        Method to remove an employee from the company.
        Parameters:
        employee - takes in the employee object that needs to be removed.
        Returns:
        a boolean value of true if the employee was removed, false if employee not found.

      • setHours

        public boolean setHours​(Employee employee)
        Method to see if the employee is a part time worker in order to set hours for them.
        Parameters:
        employee - takes in an employee object to check for part time.
        Returns:
        boolean value of true if the employee is a part time, false otherwise.

        public void processPayments()
        Method to process the payments for all employees in the company.

      • findEmployee

        public Employee findEmployee​(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String department,
                             Date dateHired)
        Method to find an employee based on their name, department, and date hired.
        Parameters:
        name - takes in the name of the employee object.
        department - takes in the department of the employee object.
        dateHired - takes in the date hired of the employee object.
        Returns:
        the employee object that is found within the company.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Method to check if the company is empty, having no employees.
        Returns:
        boolean value of true if there are no employees, false otherwise.
